website_summaries.verdict: Conveniently functioning as both a pet barrier and a pet seat, this multi-purpose model is sure to impress.
pros: Great for big dogs as the barrier can hold up to 150 pounds
Seat protector keeps vehicle safe from scratching, pet hair, and drool
Barrier equipped with pocket to hold pet's accessories
cons: Does not fit well in smaller vehicles

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing invention ever
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing invention ever! and it hold my two pitbulls perfectly. About 130 pounds between the two. And a lot of the time they ride in the same window... no problems! We love it, gave them lots of extra room on a long road trip. Here's a funny pic of them inside the car with this pet bridge supporting them.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki W

customer_reviews.title: The best!!! and I've had 3 other brands!
customer_reviews.text: With 6 Dogs this is a lifesaver! I've had three different brands of Pet bridges and this is BY FAR the BEST. It's sturdy, bigger, and just all around better. My last one kept collapsing if one of my bigger dogs stood on it. The others didn't reach all the way to the back of the seat. I have a Subaru Forrester and it fits perfectly from one side of the car to the other. So glad I finally got this new one!
customer_reviews.author: ERM

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be study enough for its purpose
customer_reviews.text: I don't own a dog, so this review isn't for them. I thought this would be a good "bridge" to cover the area between my folded-down back seat in my Subaru Outback and the front seats so the the sleeping deck could be extended for car camping. I think it will do okay for this purpose. What i don't like: that "pocket" that goes between the seats has to be on the top, so there's that. Otherwise here's the positive: super-easy installation, I mean 15 minutes for 1 person (me). If I had dogs, it would be superb for its stated purpose, no doubt. So, if you have dogs, I recommend getting it!
customer_reviews.author: The Lizzie Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. I have a Toyota Highlander, and the space in the back seat is pretty wide, so the bridge doesn't go all the way from the back of the back seat to the back of the front (as it seems to in the photo). That being said, I put a blanket down to cover it and make sure that my dog can't get his foot caught under the edge of the bridge, and it works great. My dog is so much more comfortable now that he doesn't keep falling into the space between the seats. And the strap that comes around the driver seat doesn't bother me at all.
customer_reviews.author: VA book lover

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but too slippery
customer_reviews.text: The fabric may be easy to clean and durable, but it is very slippery for our small/medium sized dogs. I have had to cover this with a large beach towel to try to make it easier for them to stand and walk on. The pocket, which also seems a good idea for storage, is too hard to access being right in the middle of the seats ... in my car (mid sized SUV) I have to kneel on the front seat to access anything from it. It would be better to have pockets closer to the doors.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my car & dog
customer_reviews.text: I used to only have one of those hammock style seat covers in the back, and my dog was hesitant to jump in and would fallover on drives because he'd step off the backseat thinking the hammock would support him. Since I installed this extender he LOVES jumping into the car. It's no longer an issue, I don't need to bribe him, he feels confident walking around back there and is able to keep his balance better. I've paired this extender with the hammock cover and it's worked really well. I put the extender in first, then a layer of that plastic carpet liner stuff for some traction, then the hammock cover.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great big roomy bed!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs - a pug, English bulldog and Boston terrier. We needed a way to transport them in my husband's truck for long (10+ hrs) business trips. We used this product yesterday for the first 11 hr trip and it worked great!! They were able to stretch out and sleep or sit up and look out the windows. It made it a very pleasant trip for us all. We did put their beds on top of the bench to make it more cushy and there was plenty of room with this platform/bench. It was the perfect solution for our needs!
customer_reviews.author: K Lynn

customer_reviews.title: This works great and fits the backseat of our Prius perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This works great and fits the backseat of our Prius perfectly. The only thing I’d point out is that the “wall” behind the front seat is not rigid; it’s effective as a safeguard if you hit the brakes, but it won’t be effective if you’re trying to keep your dog from ever getting in the front seat. Our 55# dog jumps over it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Papaya Girl

customer_reviews.title: I was worried my backseat would be too small
customer_reviews.text: I drive a RAV4, and I thought this might be a bit big, but it fits like a dream! My dogs (one huge and arthritic, one tiny puppy) are comfy and feel very secure. No possibility of either of them slipping off or getting stuck in crevices (or jumping over to bestow untimely pooch-smooches upon me). Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: M. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Not for GMC Acadia
customer_reviews.text: Leaving a neutral review. Seems fairly well made. Does not fit properly in our GMC Acadia with captain's chairs in the middle row. The bottom straps are too short to properly secure the bridge. Also, the boards as a bit too flimsy to properly bridge the gaps between the seats. I'll be building some foam cubes to fill the gaps instead...
customer_reviews.author: Brad P

customer_reviews.title: Straps too short, panels warped
customer_reviews.text: Update: I tried to use it in my Tacoma, and again, the strap that goes around the front seat is easily 12” too short. I keep this item in my garage, and the center panel has warped beyond comfortable use. I would not recommend buying this product. I just installed this in an Altima sedan and the straps that go around the seat are not long enough. Not even close. They are at least 6” too short. I will try it in my truck but early impressions are not great based on that design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good Solution for 2 Bucket Seats
customer_reviews.text: We had a bench seat in our previous vehicle and missed it upon replacing to an SUV with bucket seats in the back. This was a solution for us and the platform is very sturdy. I don't think it is particularly easy to install. It is a little confusing but we make it work. I am grateful to have found something for a bridge for our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: 2013 Ford Raptor fits well .
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2013 Raptor Extended Cab model ( which has two full-size doors, as well as a pair of smaller doors that open behind the driver and passengers ones) fits great. Had a normal seat cover (hammock style) that I just folded up underneath to level it out And to keep seat backs protected from wet dog :) did not follow instructions., just used the attached straps that worked best and tucked others out of the way .
customer_reviews.author: R.E.Wellington

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with this product!! Out of the box I was hopeful but immediately found out that the directions are useless!!!! Straps everywhere with no clear way to install the product. 2 weeks since purchase and It's still useless. more crap in the van. :-( I bought this product for my 2014 Honda Odyssey. I wanted to use it on half the back seats. If you like puzzles this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick123r45

customer_reviews.title: in the event of a 'SHORT STOP' - so Thank you very much for following up - we couldn't be more pleased
customer_reviews.text: It arrived yesterday , I installed it in our Toyota Rav 4 , and it work perfectly, it's attached to the front seats, but at least now when we travel (I-95 to Florida, for example) Teddy (our Lab, Shepard, Akita mix) will not fall in the space between the seats, in the event of a 'SHORT STOP' - so Thank you very much for following up - we couldn't be more pleased
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: I was super disappointment by this but I was still able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this today. It came with a sheet of instructions that were hard to understand and the one I received had a broken strap on one side.. I was super disappointment by this but I was still able to rearrange it to work properly in the backseat and so far it's okay.. still thinking about returning it.. If I do, I'll make sure to update this review and put what I bought instead.
customer_reviews.author: Smoreo

customer_reviews.title: Works great for large dog, just wish it was tougher
customer_reviews.text: The strap broke the first day we got this. It was pretty disappointing, but we do have a 85lbs puppy, so, I'm not super surprised. We hole punched the fabric below where the straps attach and just tied cordage through it and it works fine. It helps make my puppy feel safe in the car and it helps us feel good about him riding with us. It works very well, just wish it was tougher.
customer_reviews.author: Austin R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit, totally unusable
customer_reviews.text: Went to use this for my two dogs in the back row of a 2012 Honda Odyssey and it's too wide to fold out flat, it won't clear the arm rests. It's also too shallow to sit up against the back of the seats ahead while still covering the seats the dogs are on. Unfortunately for me, I let it sit in the box until time for the trip and now I can't return it. Might be nice for certain other vehicles, but it's useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: The Beav

customer_reviews.title: This product is working great for my dog
customer_reviews.text: This product is working great for my dog. He tended to get carsick when he laid on the floor in my truck, but I don't have a bench seat in the back, so there was no other option. That changed when I installed the pet bridge. It fits a little tight in the backseat of my cub cab pickup, but it works to span the space between the two jump seats and eliminates any gap behind the front seats. My dog is almost 90lbs. and it holds him with no problems. He is now happy to ride in the car.
customer_reviews.author: S. L Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the dogs in the seat!
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs are 26 and 16 lbs respectively. This works perfectly for them. The bouncy 16 pounder went right over the divider, but since he can jump almost 5 feet straight up, this is not a fault at all of this pet bridge. It’s sturdy, and doesn’t show stains. Most importantly, it keeps my big(ger) dog from rolling off my front seat after he unbuckles his seat belt, which takes him about 2 seconds. LOL. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zeguma Beach

customer_reviews.title: Happy 50 lb
customer_reviews.text: I have a similar product that is no longer available in my full sized car. I prefer the old one, because the divider between the front seat and backseat (at the tunnel/console) is stiff, rather than fabric. I bought this product for my Volt, and it works well except that my rear seats are contoured buckets. That makes a gap between this bridge and the rear bottom of the backseats. I am buying a second one to hang from the backseat, along with 2 small throw pillows, and fill the gap. I've already tried this and it makes a flat surface with no gaps. Happy 50 lb. dog, and no rips in the leather seats.
customer_reviews.author: RetiredGeek

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first ride!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 lab mix pups, totalling approx 110lbs together. I was so excited to get this item! Installing was not bad, instructions were easy to follow. With the first ride, one of the panels snapped right in half! All the reviews were great, sounded like a good, comfortable ride-still in shock it broke. Now I’m back to trying to find the best way to transport my pups.
customer_reviews.author: N. Craig

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEM SOLVED
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT SEEMS TO HAVE SOLVED OUR LONG TRIP PROBLEM WITH OUR SMALL DOG. INSTEAD OF SITTING ON MY LAP FOR FIVE HOURS, SHE CAN HAVE HER OWN AREA TO LOOK OUT WINDOWS AND NOT FALL DOWN ONTO FLOOR. IT IS SLIPPERY, SO YOU HAVE TO PUT A RUG OR MAT WITH NON SLIP BACKING DOWN OVER IT.
customer_reviews.author: patsyg

customer_reviews.title: No airflow
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for cross country journey with my two Great Pyrenees. After finally getting it installed, I realized that the center of the barrier also blocked airflow to the back seat. Didn’t end up using at all so unsure of the durability or sturdiness of the item. Unfortunately, I was a few days too late to be able to return this unused item.
customer_reviews.author: lisahelen

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Nice quality. Solves the seat gap pforblem perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love it! We used these for our two ratties for two 4-day road trips and couldn't be more pleased. It was easy to install in our Toyota Highlander - it took 15 mins the first time and about 4 mins thereafter. Easy peasy.
customer_reviews.author: Outinthecountry

customer_reviews.title: Good Support But Need Non-Slippery Surface
customer_reviews.text: Not hard to install but the covering material is very slick and you need to put a rug or other non-slip surface on top of it if you don't want you pet slipping around while seated on it.
customer_reviews.author: JimGeorgia

customer_reviews.title: He feels so much more comfortable and confident looking out the windows
customer_reviews.text: I have a 30lb German shepherd mix puppy who now loves car rides. He feels so much more comfortable and confident looking out the windows. I have a Kia Sportage and this fits just fine. It could be a LITTLE wider because I'm short and pull my seat way up... this will make our 10 hour drive to the beach with our little Cooper a breeze!!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee P

customer_reviews.title: Love this for my German Shepherds
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my Toyota Tundra. We have leather seats it protects the seats very well. We have 2 German Shepherds and they absolutely love the extra space. It holds thier weight grats both are about 100lbs each. The only negative is its a little slick for thier footing so throw a towel or blanket on top for your dogs.
customer_reviews.author: otis pugh

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for our pit bull to sit on in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our pit bull to sit on in the car. It broke the first time our 70lb dog got in the car and sat down on it.
customer_reviews.author: Cmy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100Lb German Shepherd. I love this thing. He is 10 an has osteoarthritis . Needless to say this thing makes it easier for a car ride. Or he can just lay in the back without falling off the back seat . I've only used this 3 times. Its easier to put him in my truck bed. Haha
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy product., does its job well. Used this to replace one of those blow up seat extenders that suffered a puncture. I highly recommend this product! I have this installed in the rear seat area of a 2011 Toyota Tundra Double Cab and it's plenty big.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a Great Pyrenees and he loves it! Gives him a little extra space to move around and lay down comfortably
customer_reviews.author: Brittany E.

customer_reviews.title: Car camping solution
customer_reviews.text: Easy solution for car camping if your car does not fold down to back of front seats. This is padded and not driving around with a piece of exposed plywood.
customer_reviews.author: NDG

customer_reviews.title: Happy dogs
customer_reviews.text: Gives more room in back seat (so both of my malinois can lie down at the same time). Fits a '17 Wrangler, but it is a little small. I wish it was a tad longer and wider to give my dogs even more space. It is slippery, so I did have to buy a long bath mat. It still slides a bit, so I'll probably glue it down.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my two dogs. Ones 100lbs and the other 60lbs. I put this in back of my 2015 gmc sierra double cab. Fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A. Reda

customer_reviews.title: Space underneath for items 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: We have seven doggies that travel in the backseat of our pickup. All but one are small. They are so much happier and safer with the Pet Bridge. No more fussing for seat space 😃. We are very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Mize

customer_reviews.title: Works in a F 350
customer_reviews.text: It should work for me no problem. I have it in the back of a Ford F 350 The only downside is the part the goes up the back side of the seat and supports the bridge is held together with Velcro. They should stitch it together
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Marty

customer_reviews.title: he is so much more comfortable in the back seat
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this, he is so much more comfortable in the back seat. He refuses to be left in the back though, he has to feel like he's riding up front with us. So we have to put the flap to the front down, my only suggestion would be to provide the opposite velcro so if it's down permanently things will not be stuck to it.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: my dog is 100 pounds and has never liked the back seat of any car until now
customer_reviews.text: my dog is 100 pounds and has never liked the back seat of any car until now. He is able to relax, stretch out and obviously feels secure now that he has a stable base under him. i have incorporated this product and a hammock that allows him to do the above. Prior to the pet bridge purchase i had the same hammock but he never would remain still and always seemed anxious. thank you for this product and i have recommended it to my friends
customer_reviews.author: srfin64

customer_reviews.title: We have a 75 lb pit mix and we love this for him
customer_reviews.text: We have a 75 lb pit mix and we love this for him! He's finally able to roam around the back without any issues. He hated being on the floor and this brings him up at eye level with us with added safety and security. We did add his dog bed on top of the bridge just because he likes laying down on it, so the slipping is not an issue for us. We highly recommend this product! Fit our 2016 Ford F150
customer_reviews.author: Tammi

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm, that's saying something with a full grown boxer and lab to contain. Gave them plenty of room to move around and lay down to sleep on the 17 hour drive, during moving. Will get a lot used out it. Although, the straps didn't fit as well as I would have liked, that's the reason for a four star v/s a five
customer_reviews.author: DRG

customer_reviews.title: Give more space to your lovely pet
customer_reviews.text: Ours back seat was little tight for my dog, especially when she was sitting and looking windshield. But after installed this, her sitting position, and moving are better and safe.
customer_reviews.author: B. Park

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Looking for something to fit in the back of my husbands truck where the dogs would be comfortable for our trip to Florida. This fits the bill....perfect fit for his 2016 Chevy Silverado back seat. Everything worked perfectly.....
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: I paid for new but received a used item. Definitely not acceptable.
customer_reviews.text: I received a USED item that showed damage and use to the straps. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: franca

customer_reviews.title: Too big for Scion tc, but great support
customer_reviews.text: This was good in the stability and level surface aspect that I needed it for, however it was too large to fit flat across the backseat of my 2006 scion tc. It was also a little difficult to install, though I imagine it would be easier in a 4 door vehicle where you can access the back seat easily.
customer_reviews.author: Megan M.

customer_reviews.title: The board seemed sturdy at first
customer_reviews.text: This thing is okay. I have a 06 Toyota Highlander and it fits the width, but doesn't cover all the back seat as in the photo. I have my seats all the way back and there is about a six in gap between the back of the back seat and the back edge of this shelf, leaving part of the back seat exposed. The board seemed sturdy at first, but after two weeks it snapped under the weight of my 90 lb. German Shepard Dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect solution for our german shepherd. She has problems with her rear leg and cannot use them much any longer. We had always put her in crate when she went to the vet but with her rear legs now, she could no longer physically get out of the crate. So I bought the pet bridge to prevent her from falling into the leg area in the back seat. It works perfect and completely holds her 80 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: LoriZ

customer_reviews.title: More space to roam
customer_reviews.text: I just love this product. It gives my Standard Poodle more room to move around in the back seat. It is safe and sturdy product. It fits just fine on my 2005 Honda Pilot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: we are using it so the seat is more like a bench seat rather than a bucket
customer_reviews.text: It is ok and would get 5 starts if it fit my vehicle. Chevy Tahoe is to big to use the front seat attachment. However, we are using it so the seat is more like a bench seat rather than a bucket.... which the dogs LOVE. Also, we did not like the fact that the dogs were blocked by the center piece. Would be nice if there were a zip down option. I will say it is very sturdy and the dogs do love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Smart

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Could have a simpler way to hang I sewed all strap connector with Velcro works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Marengo

customer_reviews.title: works well enough if dog is well trained.  ours is a puppy...
customer_reviews.text: keeps dog in one area if dog is trained and doesn't wait for you in driver seat. i guess that is something we need to work on. my only wish is that the platform was thickly padded. the dog slides around a lot which may be comic but discourages dog from laying down
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Great concept
customer_reviews.text: This was really awesome for the three I have had it, until one of the buckles broke making the product unstable. I contacted the seller to see if they are willing to help me find a solution. I will update the review if they do help me resolve the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kinga

customer_reviews.title: The best thing I've ever bought for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for 2012 Honda Civic. My dogs love it b/c they are no longer wobbling all of the place with the seat protector. They are more stable. The best thing I ever purchased for my wonderful friends - my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Lydie

customer_reviews.title: Probably be good for lightweight small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't good for my big dogs. The clip broke on the first day. I put a blanket down over it and when it moved the bridge material was so slippery for them. Maybe the clips should be metal and not plastic for better performance.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: I would highly suggest it for dogs who like to invade your front seat space
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly in the back seat of our truck. It works perfectly for our German Shepherd; she now has the space she needs to lay down and relax in the car. I would highly suggest it for dogs who like to invade your front seat space.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Chase

customer_reviews.title: So much better than the competitors!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect!! It goes far enough onto the seat that the corners won't break off, but if the panels DO break, the pockets have Velcro, so you can replace them easily!!! I would recommend this to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Royel89

customer_reviews.title: Great durability and sturdiness when placed across 2 captains chairs.
customer_reviews.text: It fit perfectly across 2 captains chairs in our chevy traverse. It is very sturdy and didn't budge once its strapped in place. Our dog is 52 pounds and it holds her well. Worked great as a bridge so my dog wont fall off the seat when breaking..I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Buonora

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: My 55 lb pit bull loves it, very easy to install... we just put pillows by the door because he fell thru
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic seat cover!
customer_reviews.text: Put this in a Subaru Legacy and drove with three dogs 12 hours both ways. Worked amazing!! No worrying about them falling off the seat, it blocked them from jumping up front and never shifted or got disconnected. Wish I had found this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: M.Rea

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the product. Great quality and sturdiness. I would give it 5 stars all around if it also draped over the back seat in order to keep the dog hair contained within. I think most people would be willing to pay a small premium for the added convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Works
customer_reviews.text: Pups love this extended seat. They get closer to us. I added pillows on top as you can see. Keeps straight, no movement. Hard to tell, but I covered it with a sheet for protection. Heavy enough for pups to lie.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense

customer_reviews.title: Good addition
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs ,a grayhound lab mix. and a beagle border collie mix. Their weight is no problem, it gives them more space . My only concern is that it could be wider in the base area, I had to but small blanket to take up space so they wouldn't injure their legs.
customer_reviews.author: mary dashnier

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for my 2014 GMC Terrain
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for my 2014 GMC Terrain .I was pleasantly surprised by the quality and fit of this bridge. My dog is a stocky breed and weighs about 70 pounds and has no problem supporting her weight. She is no longer is able to climb over the console or fall down between the rear seat. This was money well spent and I definitely recommend this item to those who have a similar type vehicle and face the same issues of keeping your pet safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: John Schell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for my Truck's back seat.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a nine year old Lab and she loves hopping in the car, like all pups, when I go out. But she had a hard time getting used to the limited spaces of my RAM's back seat. This was the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: JpForest

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves it. He can move around but not too much. Seems more relaxed being in the car
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous the way they straps are put in your dog can get their leg caught in break it
customer_reviews.text: This is very very dangerous and it's a death trap for dogs breaking their legs I refuse to use it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Pets and seats safe
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Perfect solution to save my car seats. Plus my pets will not fall into the space between the seats, giving them more room and keeping them safe.
customer_reviews.author: EKO

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea but....
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my SUV since the gap between 1st and 2nd row is to large. Description said for Trucks and SUVs but it is not wide enough to cover the whole back seat as shown in the picture above
customer_reviews.author: Conny F.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: We've been on two extended vacations with the dogs and this has kept the seats looking new and given the pups more room for the long rides.
customer_reviews.author: BrianW

customer_reviews.title: More space for my german shepherd and it protects my leather seats
customer_reviews.text: I have a Ford Edge that I use with this bridge. I use a piece of memory foam because there is space between the end of the bridge and the seats. I like the fact that it gives my pet more room which gives him a comfortable ride. I also have storage area between the floor and the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: KPC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Directions weren't real good but managed....using it on it's first trip......to be continued
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Maybe for a small car.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t fit in my small suv so it flops around when my dog stands on it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Blair

customer_reviews.title: My 70 lb english bulldog likes it
customer_reviews.text: My 70 lb english bulldog likes it. Makes him more comfortable on car rides
customer_reviews.author: yessenia

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I travel alot so this has proved to be very handy for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Nola wondernine

customer_reviews.title: Not for large puppies. Or dogs that can jump over
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of time and money for our two bulldog puppies. It would work well for older or smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Patty Manhire

customer_reviews.title: Back seat cover
customer_reviews.text: Super happy with my purchase I have a 2016 Ford SuperCrew it fits perfectly I have an 85 lb Golden Retriever so this was a must
customer_reviews.author: Brent H.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Still early
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Still early. I placed on folded down seats because there was a gap between seat headrest and front seats rather than on top of rear seat bottom as pictured. Dog seems to like it. Quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: This item is wonderful! We have 2 mini Aussies and it gives ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is wonderful! We have 2 mini Aussies and it gives them so much more room. I like that you can still put items underneath behind the seat too. This is a great value and folds up for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust
customer_reviews.text: It’s not deep enough if you drive with your seat somewhat forward.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Thornburg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough for my 2 medium sized dogs. Makes more room when you have a small back seat space. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Our dog WANTS to be in the front seat - ...
customer_reviews.text: Our dog WANTS to be in the front seat - first try, he made it up to the front, but on the second try, he stayed in the back and slept. I say SUCCESS!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great space expanded!
customer_reviews.text: Fit our Flord Flex to a tee! Will work when we take our two dogs and one cat up north! (115 lb dog, 13 lb dog and 18 lb cat!) need the extra crate space in back seat for two Smaller occupants!
customer_reviews.author: Lorna McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this product Have an almost 100 lb American bulldog/lab who doesn't like car rides but now he feels much safer and has more space with this product.I bought a rubber backed mat for it so he doesn't slip. I have a Durango.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. My dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. My dog loves it. Relatively easy to remove and install. Good back seat and dog protection.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product!!! Installation was a bit confusing, but no biggie. It is a very sturdy pet bridge, and I was able to position it perfectly and tightly in my SUV truck. Excellent quality too. So far so good.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily and Slippery
customer_reviews.text: A clip broke the first time it was used. Also, this is very slippery. So instead of sliding on to the floor, our dog was sliding into the doors. This is getting returned.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and foldable boards
customer_reviews.text: Love this backseat pet bridge. Our two small dogs ride safely and we don’t have to worry about them falling thru the seats. Easy to install and good material. Fitted properly in our midsize SUV.

customer_reviews.title: Much better at covering/ bridging the space between our front and ...
customer_reviews.text: Much better at covering/ bridging the space between our front and back seats. Because it is wider, it is more secure for our 2 dogs than other 'bridges" that we have used.
customer_reviews.author: inhouse guests

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, nonslippery, keeps the dirt and leaves on the bridge, not on the floor or back seat.  Yeah!
customer_reviews.text: No more dog trying to hijack my car. She rides in the back now. She doesn't slip around, the material is firm and holds her weight well. Best thing I've ever purchased for my retriever.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Very good item.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for your pet/pets to walk freely back and forth window to window. Recommend adding zip line, so as to keep dogs secure.

customer_reviews.title: Keep your pets from falling into the abyss
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I only had one (115 lb) dog, we have since added a rescue (33 lbs) they are very comfortable.

customer_reviews.text: Best investment I made in a long time. Dogs stay in back seat and are comfortable

customer_reviews.title: We travel back home to IL a lot and with ...
customer_reviews.text: We travel back home to IL a lot and with the decision to get a second dog, we decided more space was needed in the backseat. This has been a life saver for traveling and gives the girls plenty of room to relax! Our dogs are 45lbs and 55lbs for reference.

product_meta.title: Frontpet Backseat Vehicle Pet Bridge - Dog Car Back-Seat Extender Platform, Seat Cover Divider Barrier, Ideal for Trucks, SUVs, and Full Sized Sedans (Fits 23in x 55in Backseat Area or Larger)
feature_bullets: SAFE- Creates an extended safe and comfortable space for your pet to travel while in the back seat of your vehicle! Fits backseat areas 23in x 55in and larger.
SECURE- This pet vehicle seat barrier keeps your vehicle interior safe protecting from claws and hair by covering all areas of the car your pet will be occupying!

STURDY- Holds up to 150 Pounds. Built with a hardwood interior, wrapped with comfortable foam padding and enforced by sturdy nylon straps ensures your pet bridge barrier will deliver longevity and comfort!
CONVENIENT- This car platform can be installed and removed in only minutes! It also folds into a compact square so storage is a breeze!
FUNCTIONAL- Additional storage space in the seat barrier allows for you to bring all of your pets toys, treats and accessories while on the go!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars303 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
